name: auto_drl
description:
DistributedRateLimiting Service.
Distributed rate limiting allows administrators to set a limit on the aggregate 
outgoing traffic rate for a set of nodes without putting a single static limit 
on any individual node. Given an aggregate rate limit, the participating nodes 
each use a portion of the limit according to the current traffic demands at the nodes.

name: inria_manipooja
description: To develop a Software Defined Network Controller (SDNC) for decision making (Routing, Data Transfer MAC, and Radiofrequency selection) in normal/emergency scenarios based on acquired humans body parameters from different sensor nodes. It is capable of communicating on IEEE 802.15.6 (Narrow band and Ultra-wideband)  communication standard to incorporate the quality of service parameters for the WBAN.

name: inria_oai.laas
description:
slice for Imane Oussakel <ioussake@laas.fr>

I'm working on wireless metrology using SDR for QoS reinforcement. Especially, the case of connected cars that would be handled using 4G network.

I'm using Openairinterface for my experiment in the laas' anechoic chamber. Now, i want to run one eNB(oai) with two or more UEs. As i need more data to train the ML

name: inria_rathod
description: I am a Research Scholar in NITK, Surathkal, India. I am working in an Internet of Things. My research area is to handling the congestion in the Internet of Things. A wireless network is one kind of part in IoT. Right now, I don't know how this lab is useful to me. But once I get familiar with this lab, I will find some scenarios to get some results or outputs from r2lab.

name: inria_oot
description:
I'm a Master's student in Computer Science at the Federal University of Minas Gerais. My dissertation involves Cognitive Radio and Machine Learning applications to Wireless Networks. SDR is the basis platform I have been using for running real-world experiments. The lab I'm associated with has, indeed, some SDRs available in a testbed fashion (http://futebol.dcc.ufmg.br/). However, our testbed is limited to a smaller number of SDRs and has a loser environment (i.e we have no control over external sources of interferences). I would like to use the R2lab infrastructure to run some experiments of mine, mainly related to my dissertation. Essentially, it would consist of running OOT gnuradio modules very related to the ones listed in 1. and 2., 
https://andreviniciusgsg.github.io/projects/.

name: inria_lqe
description:
I'm a professor of Computer Engineering at Federal University of Ceará, Brazil (http://www.ec.ufc.br/professores/wendley/index-eng.html).
In addition, my PhD research involves the use of SDR (USRP B210) to develop new Link Quality Estimators.

name: inria_infosys
description:
From: Praveen Kumar Kalapatapu <Praveen_Kalapatapu@infosys.com>
I am a Senior Architect from Infosys Ltd and I am responsible for 5G/SDN research/innovation within infosys.  We work with various telecom service providers and also OEMs in multiple areas  including RAN Config Mgmt, Planning, Validation, SDN/NFV, Virtualization of NF  etc. 

We have 5G Center of Excellence within our organization. We actively contribute to open source solutions/forums like ONOS/Tmforum/ETSI/ONOS etc. We are planning to utilize use R2lab for experimenting on 5G Usecases ie. Cloud-RAN and  Network slicing use case with various architectural variations using open source frameworks like OAI, SDR, M-CORD etc..

name: inria_juniper
description:
I am Prasanth Kemparaj, working as a software engineer in Juniper Networks, Bengaluru, Karnataka.
I would like to do few experimennts on 5G fronthaul. So I would like to use r2lab for this.

name: inria_wipro
description:
I am Telecom/Datacom Domain expert and worked in 2G/3G/4G Technology products. I have 16+ years of experience working in many Telecom products.

In the recent days we started exploring more about 5G and it’s architecture. I am interested more about  OpenAirInterface and its LAB access.

name: inria_toshiba
description: I am a principal researcher with the telecommunications research laboratory of Toshiba in Europe. My main area of research is design and optimization of wireless networks with emphasis on cellular, Wi-Fi and sensor networks. For R2lab, my main interest is running 5G and LTE-related experiments leveraging open air interface.

name: inria_havelsan
description:
sarp köksal: I am currently working for Havelsan A.Ş in Ankara, Turkey as software engineer. We have “5G Project”. We want to use OpenAir Interface in order to simulate our systems and we want to R2LABs to do it.

Eylül Ünal: I am working on OpenAirInterface. Especially on NFVI/SDN but Core Network is our part of the project. I would like to use this testped for OpenAirInterface. 

Kind regards,

Sarp Köksal

name: auto_netflow
description:
PlanetFlow Traffic Auditing Service.
Logs, captured in the root context using fprobe-ulogd, are stored in a
directory in the root context which is bind mounted to the planetflow
slice.  The Planetflow Central service then periodically rsyncs these
logs from the planetflow slice for aggregation.

name: auto_sirius
description:
PlanetFlow Traffic Auditing Service.
Logs, captured in the root context using fprobe-ulogd, are stored in a
directory in the root context which is bind mounted to the planetflow
slice.  The Planetflow Central service then periodically rsyncs these
logs from the planetflow slice for aggregation.

name: inria_cefore
description: Slice to test Cefore ICN mechanism provided by NICT

name: inria_toshiba2
description:
I am currently working as a Research Engineer at Toshiba Research Europe Limited based in Bristol, UK.

I have a PhD in Wireless Communications from University of Bristol, UK. I worked in the wireless industry for nearly 8+ years.

My main interests include 5G, Industrial IOT, ultra reliable low latency communication, channel modelling, V2X communication, Network slicing and optimisation.

 

I would like to use R2lab testbed for 5G end to end network based on Open Air Interface. To start off, I would like to implement network slicing (both RAN and core) for 5G ultra reliable low latency communication (uRLLC).

Using the Open Air Interface, i would like to make MAC layer enhancements for uRLLC communication.

name: inria_juniper
description:
I am Prasanth Kemparaj, working as a software engineer in Juniper Networks.
I would like to do few experimennts on 5G fronthaul. So I would like to use r2lab for this.

name: inria_mosaic
description: Offering OpenAirInterface images based on mosaic5g

name: inria_novisad
description:
I am PhD student at the Department of Power, Electronic and Communication Engineering at the Faculty of Technical Sciences, University of Novi Sad.  I have started my doctoral studies in Power, Electronic and
Communication Engineering and from September 2016 i am working as a Teaching Assistant at Faculty of Technical Sciences, University of Novi Sad.  Being a teaching assistant at the University of Novi Sad, I am involved in preparation of subject entitled ”Cognitive radio”, in which lab exercises will employ both USRP and GNU Radio.  Knowledge and experience that R2lab tastbed can provide to me and to the department that I work, is of great importance. It would also have a great impact on my future work and for my future research, as i am planning to follow all excersises and after that i will try to consult with my supervisor Dejan Vukobratovic about some experiments that we want to prepare and test.

name: inria_acqua
description: ACQUA – A forecast of your Internet Quality of Experience!

name: inria_ntnu
description:
I am a MSc student at the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU, www.ntnu.edu) and I am currently doing preliminary work for a thesis related to identity management in future 5G networks. The exact objectives of the thesis are not decided yet, but the plan is to include practical experiments as a part of the thesis. I am thus looking for potential candidate testbeds to perform these experiments on and to familiarize myself with them so I can decide which one(s) to use.
The thesis work itself will not start until over the summer, but the sooner I decide on the testbed(s) to use, the more prepared I will be.

As of now I do not have any more details with regards to the type of experiments, but don't hesitate to ask me if you need more information and I will do my best to answer them.

Best regards,
Vemund Dahle
vemundd@stud.ntnu.no

name: inria_tudelft
description:
I am doing my masters at TU Delft. My subject of study is LPWAN. Currently, I have started my thesis, which is on NB-IoT.

I would like to use the facility to do measurements for NB-IoT scenario.


As I am a beginner to Open Air Interface and a first time user of R2Lab, it would be a great help if you can point me to resources to do my experimentations for the same.


Anup Bhattacharjee
A.K.Bhattacharjee@student.tudelft.nl

name: inria_distrinet
description: Distrinet experimentation

BAH THIERNO MAMOUDOU p1518166 <thierno-mamoudou.bah@etu.univ-lyon1.fr>

name: inria_dante
description:
I'm a Phd student in Lyon (ENS de Lyon / INSA de Lyon in the inria dante / chroma team), and I'm mainly interested in WiFi (my thesis is on « controlled mobility for uav networks »). Right now, my experiments are mainly involving a few nodes, but I lack access to some "reproductible" radio conditions, and I'd also like to evaluate how my result would stand with other hardware.

Rémy Grünblatt <remy.grunblatt@inria.fr>
